items.text: 139kph, shorter length, wide of off, he sits back and opens the face running it to wide third man
items.shortText: Ngidi to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run

items.preText: Badhon007 : "Bangladesh are banking on Mithun because of his 2 half century that he scored in NZ this February where BD had a extremely poor performance. On the other hand , Liton got two chance after arriving in the UK and got 70+ in both innings. Such a poor call from the team management, leaving a inform batsman like this."
items.text: 140kph, good length, leg stump, he works this neatly to the gap at midwicket
items.shortText: Ngidi to Tamim Iqbal, 1 run

items.text: cracking front foot pull shot! This was a half-tracker, no venom, he stood up and smoked it over forward square, one bounce four. Super shot
items.shortText: Ngidi to Soumya Sarkar, FOUR runs

items.text: And again! Even better. Slightly shorter and wider, he climbed all over it smashed this over wide mid on!
items.postText: Wajid Jawaid: "With these 10:30 am starts, a score of 40 for none (or one) at the end of 10 overs should be a good achievement for the team batting first"
items.shortText: Ngidi to Soumya Sarkar, FOUR runs

items.text: 134kph, good length on off, he defends with soft hands trying to get it to third man but second slip cuts it off
items.shortText: Ngidi to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: edged between first and second slip! Oh no! Change of angle, coming in and nipping away, he pushed at it with limited footwork, Faf moved to his right at second and then pulled out of it and watched it go past, Markram didn't move having seen Faf move! If flew between them at catchable height!
items.shortText: Ngidi to Soumya Sarkar, FOUR runs

items.text: fuller swinging into the pads but pitching outside leg
items.shortText: Rabada to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: 137kph, short lifter angled outside off, he rises and withdraws the bat inside the line
items.shortText: Rabada to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: a bouncer flies over the keeper's head! Five wides. It was way too short and de Kock jumped as high as he could but it cleared him!
items.shortText: Rabada to Tamim Iqbal, 5 wides

items.text: good length, he defends into the covers, wants one but is wisely sent back as the fielder pounces
items.shortText: Rabada to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: lovely square drive on the up! It was a good length and wide of off, he didn't time it perfectly but controlled it and placed it through point and it raced away
items.shortText: Rabada to Tamim Iqbal, FOUR runs

items.text: good length, 145kph, angled across and he leaves
items.postText: Jack: "This is captivating, I feared that this WC would be a batting smash and grab but bowlers are actually showcasing skills on pitches with a bit of life! More of this!"
items.shortText: Rabada to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: rearing bouncer, he fends off the glove onto shoulder and it pops up but falls safe! Well short of de Kock running in
items.postText: Our Match Day expert Daren Ganga believes Bangladesh are most vulnerable against the short-ball. Agree with his views? Soumya Sarkar seems to be on a mission against the short ball today.
items.shortText: Rabada to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: edged along the ground wide of second! Again it drew the edge, half forward but lovely soft hands this time and it runs wide of du Plessis and away fine of third
items.shortText: Ngidi to Soumya Sarkar, FOUR runs

items.text: over-pitched and driven magnificently down the ground! Glorious shot this. It was a half-volley but his footwork and weight transfer was superb to drive it past the bowler, straight of mid off
items.shortText: Ngidi to Soumya Sarkar, FOUR runs

items.text: 141kph, full again, he gets a thick inside edge driving but it goes safely along the ground to fine leg
items.shortText: Ngidi to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run

items.text: 135kph, good length, top of off, he's forward covering the line, defending off the inside half of the bat
items.shortText: Ngidi to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.preText: Bilal Mustafa: "Soumya on destroy the short ball mission, bravo. "
items.text: 134kph, fuller, he defends back to the bowler, Ngidi fields and fires a throw at the stumps and Tamim has to defend it away from his body with his bat! Everything is ok though. No one is worried
items.shortText: Ngidi to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: Crunch through midwicket! Too short and Tamim latches onto a pull and pounds it through the big gap at midwicket
items.postText: Ngidi has headed off the ground into the rooms. Will keep you posted.
items.shortText: Ngidi to Tamim Iqbal, FOUR runs

items.text: shorter length, he's squared up but defends it well enough
items.postText: There's a delay. Soumya broke his bat. Isam: "Bangladesh have won 11 out of 16 ODIs since the 2015 World Cup when they have had a 50-run opening stand."
items.shortText: Rabada to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: beautifully guided fine of third man! Lovely placement and control. Shorter length and a fraction wide, with the angle he opened the blade and guided it away wide of slip
items.shortText: Rabada to Soumya Sarkar, FOUR runs

items.text: edged short of de Kock! He tried to guide fine again, got a bottom edge but it bounced short of the keeper
items.shortText: Rabada to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: Superb cover drive! Supreme stroke from Soumya. Slightly over-pitched and just played the text book cover drive with a touch class.
items.shortText: Rabada to Soumya Sarkar, FOUR runs

items.text: shorter length, 145kph, he's back and trying to run it to third man, du Plessis flies across from second slip and saves it on the bounce
items.shortText: Rabada to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: 142kph, back of a length, wide of off, he leaves this alone
items.postText: Rohan: "Wait, wasn't that obstructing the field..I remember Inzamam was given out for that..SA should have appealed for that" They didn't. I don't that would have been in the spirit of what took place. They never considered it.
items.shortText: Rabada to Soumya Sarkar, no run
